diff_hunk:
@@ -9,6 +9,10 @@
 # Make `form_with` generate non-remote forms.
 Rails.application.config.action_view.form_with_generates_remote_forms = false
 
+# The belongs_to associations are required by default in Rails 5
+# we cannot opt into this right now, but it would be a goal for the future
+Rails.application.config.active_record.belongs_to_required_by_default = false
body:
🙈 thanx a million for pointing this out @carpodaster 🙏 
I since forever "just used"™️ `inverse_of`, because I thought it would do some behind the scenes optimization for looking up the association (see the beginning of [this blogpost from back in the days](https://www.viget.com/articles/exploring-the-inverse-of-option-on-rails-model-associations)).
**BUT** as it turns out, this was already added as a default behavior to Rails 4 (and therefore probably also Rails 5). It's probably still around for associations where the inverse cannot automatically be determined by the name - but for basic cases like most of the associations in the Teams App, this is obsolete 💡 

So I guess I can ditch the `inverse_of`s I added in this PR 🎉 

Learned something - yay!
